etymologies: mid 19th century. From Hindi haldū (also hardū) kind of Himalayan tree, ultimately from Sanskrit haridru kind of yellow tree (from hari yellow + dru wood), probably via a related language of the Himalayas

definitions: A large deciduous tree with heart-shaped leaves, native to South and South-East Asia, Adina cordifolia (or Haldina cordifolia) (family Rubiaceae). Also: the pale yellowish hardwood timber of this tree, used especially for furniture.

notes.text: The roots and bark of this tree have a number of applications as herbal remedies in Ayurvedic medicine.
